text: The Allard Pierson Museum is a archaeological museum in Amsterdam. The museum was founded in 1934.Casa Editrice Bonechi, Amsterdam. Ediz. Inglese (Florence, Italy: Bonechi, 2007), p. 45 It is part of the University of Amsterdam. Since 1976 it has been located the building of the former Dutch bank. == History == The Allard Pierson Museum is named after Allard Pierson (1831-1896). He was the first professor of archaeology at the University of Amsterdam. == References == == Other websites == * Allard Pierson Museum Category:Museums in the Netherlands Category:Buildings and structures in Amsterdam Category:1934 establishments in Europe Category:1930s establishments in the Netherlands
title: Allard Pierson Museum
